# GUI's

-   Graphical User Interface (GUI) are useful tools that allow the user to work without typing.

# Shiny

-   Interface between R and JavaScript
-   Making offline file of png generated by R script, JavaScript displays the result
-   See Hadley's 'Mastering Shiny' for more information
    -   <https://mastering-shiny.org/>
-   Try creating a Shiny with fake data prior to a real experiment to better understand the possible outcomes

## Example Shiny (CTD data)

```{r, eval=F}
#R Setup
library(oce)
library(shiny)
dir <- "~/data/arctic/beaufort/2012"
files <- list.files(dir, ".cnv")

#Define Shiny GUI
selectInput(inputId="file",
            label=paste("Select CNV in ", dir), 
            choices=files)

#Plot in Shiny if 'input$file' has changed
renderPlot(
    {
        d <- read.oce(paste0(dir, "/", input$file))
        plot(d)
    }, height=600, pointsize=18)
```
